summary: This is an email exchange between an Assistant United States Attorney and a law clerk regarding the correction and signing of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest warrant. The original warrant had an incorrect date (2019) and a corrected version with the date of June 29, 2020, was provided for Judge Smith's signature.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: The Honorable Judge Smith is the judge to whom the law clerk is assigned and who is requested to sign the corrected arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The arrest warrant being corrected and signed is for Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating her impending or recent arrest in June 2020.

connections.description: Judge Smith is the judicial officer responsible for signing the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Correction and Signing of Maxwell Arrest Warrant
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends a corrected version of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest warrant (with the date changed from 2019 to June 29, 2020) to a law clerk for Judge Smith to sign.

locations: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (Southern District of New York office address)
keyFacts: A corrected arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell was prepared and signed on June 29, 2020.
The original warrant contained an incorrect date (2019), which was corrected to reflect the actual date in 2020.
The correspondence involves an Assistant U.S. Attorney and a law clerk for Judge Lisa Margaret Smith of the Southern District of New York.
This document indicates procedural steps taken in the federal case against Ghislaine Maxwell leading to her arrest.
